teaser: Domestic migration, when you move from one place in the country to another, plunged in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. Now things are looking up.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, May 23, 2013
title: What do home sales have to do with the job market?
description: Domestic migration, when you move from one place in the country to another, plunged in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. Now things are looking up.
contentencoded:
When you can sell a house more easily you can go in search of a new job more easily. Domestic migration, when you move from one place in the country to another, plunged in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. Now things are looking up. Existing home sales at their highest level since 2009. The latest monthly data on new home sales comes out this morning.

Marketplace economics correspondent Chris Farrell joins Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss why people are moving, where they are going, and what it means for the economy.
